thread.title: Ohio programs get grants for crime-victim services
thread.title_full: Ohio programs get grants for crime-victim services | The Columbus Dispatch

author: From wire reports
title: Ohio programs get grants for crime-victim services
text:
COLUMBUS â€” Ohio Attorney General Mike DeWine says more than 300 providers in Ohio will share $51 million in grant money for delivering services to crime victims.
The money is from a grant increase from a Department of Justice fund financed by federal settlements, fines and fees. The money will help agencies that provide services to at-risk youths and human-trafficking victims, court-appointed special advocates and child-advocacy centers.
About $15 million will support services for domestic-violence victims, nearly $10 million will go to prosecutor-based programs, and $9 million will help victims of sexual assault. About $1.3 million will help implement a 24-hour statewide sexual-violence hotline.
